alert.note: Alert for Klamath (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 18 at 9:54AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Flood Potential Outlook for snow melt flooding, quick rises of streams and creeks to near bankfull, and ponding of low-lying areas as well as poorly draining urban areas... In California... Modoc... Siskiyou... In Oregon... Coos... Curry... Douglas... Jackson... Josephine... Klamath... Lake... A long duration atmospheric river event is forecast to bring 1 to 5 inches of rain to the region from Friday night through Monday morning. Rainfall amounts are expected to be highest in southwestern Siskiyou, Josephine and Curry County. However, excessive rainfall with snow levels consistently around 6000 feet and a meltable snow pack, raises the risk for more widespread flooding. As well as flooding concerns, this rainfall could also lead to increased occurrences of rockfall and localized land slides. A flood potential outlook is issued when there is the potential for significant rises or flooding along rivers and streams. The exact scenario for flooding remains uncertain. This product will be updated as necessary. Watches and warnings may be issued by the National Weather Service if this situation worsens.
